sense.name: nonspatial progress
sense.commentary: any nonspatial maneuver made as part of progress toward a goal
sense.examples: The situation called for strong measures. The police took steps to reduce crime.

sense.name: distance
sense.commentary: footstep, pace, stride - the distance covered by a step (used to measure length)
sense.examples: He walked off ten steps from the old tree and began to dig. The box was buried fifteen steps from the corner of the garage. The treasure map's form of measurements were in steps.

sense.name: act of stepping
sense.commentary: STEP[+event] the act of changing location by raising the foot and setting it down
sense.examples: His steps were unsteady. His ankle hurt more with each step. Taking those five steps took all of his courage. He took ten minutes to walk those five steps.

sense.name: stair
sense.commentary: support consisting of a place to rest the foot while ascending or descending a stairway
sense.examples: He paused on the bottom step. The staircase had 15 spiraling steps.

sense.name: gradiation
sense.commentary: relative position in a graded series
sense.examples: ...always a step behind Subtle steps in color... Keep in step with the fashions.

sense.name: a stone's throw
sense.commentary: a short distance - underestimate of measurement sense
sense.examples: It is only a step to the drugstore. We moved only a step from the ice cream store.

sense.name: sound
sense.commentary: footfall, footstep - the sound of a step of someone walking
sense.examples: He heard steps on the porch. Fido began barking when he heard steps in the driveway.

sense.name: tone
sense.commentary: whole tone, whole step - a musical interval of two semitones
sense.examples: Most of the piece was written in whole steps.

sense.name: visible footprint
sense.commentary: footprint, footmark - a mark of a foot or shoe on a surface (result of a step)
sense.examples: The police made casts of the footprint in the mud. The animal's dusty steps could be seen all over the cars.

sense.name: piece of a ship
sense.commentary: a solid block joined to the beams in which the heel of a ship's mast or capstan is fixed
sense.examples: The step became unstable after the shipwreck.

sense.name: dance
sense.commentary: dance step - a sequence of foot movements that make-up a particular dance
sense.examples: He taught them the waltz step.
